text: How can you recognize a linear pattern of change in a verbal context, a table, a graph, an expression, or an equation?

• Main idea: Relationships are linear when there is a constant rate of change between the two variables.
  • Verbal context: keywords include constant, [increase/decrease] by the same amount every [year/second/month]‚Äù
  • Table: as the value of the independent variable changes by a constant amount, the dependent variable changes by a constant amount.
  • Graph: The graph is a straight line.
  • Expression: The independent variable is raised to the 1st power and is multiplied by a constant.
  • Equation: The independent variable is multiplied by a constant, so the dependent variable will change at a constant rate.
